text: 18.75 Part 1(c) requires development to demonstrate that they will not have a negative impact on open or water spaces. This is particularly applicable to tall buildings, as the overshadowing and light spill effects of tall buildings can have negative impacts on ecosystems in both blue and green spaces, and in many cases it is preferable to set taller buildings back from the edge of these spaces and step heights down as developments approach the water. Tall buildings can also create problems with bird strike, which is a particular risk on bird migration or commuting routes such as along the river Thames and river Lea, and between the Thames and other water bodies, and the design BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE
